subject: pedals info
description_text:
what s the difference between Plus x and Pro x ? (excluding haptic motors
and RGB)
I mean the technical parts are the same?

Are you working  also on pedal set ONLY with springs like VX pro and VRS?

Thanks

Rocco from Italy

conversations.body_text: Hi La nuova Terra,  Please send me a photo or screenshot of the VX Pro and VRS springs so I can verify, as we also have optional configurations available. Both PlusX and ProX Ultra support vibration feedback interfaces, while the Ultra version features LED lighting, 16-bit resolution, and 8-level damping adjustment. You can choose the one that best suits your personal preference.

these 2 famous pedals builders are without elastomers only steel springs.

i m looking for this concept but cheaper

https://vrs.racing/hardware/pro-pedals

and

https://simgrade.fi/product/vx-pro-pedals/






Il dom 5 ott 2025, 18:36 service@simsonn.com

Hi La nuova Terra,    Our pedals can also be used without the rubber or hydraulic dampers, relying solely on springs if you prefer.  The hydraulic damper mainly provides data buffering, stabilizing the pedal signal and enhancing the realistic travel feel.  The rubber damper adds secondary braking resistance and muscle memory, supporting nine different pressure curves for precise pedal tuning.     The pedal model you mentioned has a simpler design, but it can’t match our product’s feel, stability, and accuracy.  In addition, our system supports vibration feedback and telemetry, fully compatible with our SIMSONN haptic motors for a more immersive driving experience.
